briefdescription.para: Add legend nodes for layer nodes.
For legends that support it, will show them in a tree instead of a list (needs also ShowLegend). Added in 2.8.
Defer legend model invalidation.
Layer nodes may optionally include extra embedded widgets (if used in QgsLayerTreeView). Added in 2.16.
Allow reordering with drag'n'drop.
Allow renaming of groups and layers.
Allow user to set node visibility with a checkbox.
Allow check boxes for legend nodes (if supported by layer's legend)
Check/uncheck action has consequences on children (or parents for leaf node)
Minimal number of nodes when legend should be automatically collapsed. -1 = disabled.
Current index - will be underlined.
Sets of flags for the model.
Overrides of map layers' styles: key = layer ID, value = style XML.

detaileddescription.para: This allows showing a legend that is different from the current style of layers

briefdescription.para: Per layer data about layer's legend nodes.
scale denominator for filtering of legend nodes (<= 0 means no filtering)
whether to use map filtering
Pointer to the root node of the layer tree. Not owned by the model.
Construct a new tree model with given layer tree (root node must not be null pointer).

detaileddescription.para: The root node is not transferred by the model.

briefdescription.para: Returns at what number of legend nodes the layer node should be collapsed. -1 means no auto-collapse (default).
Gets index of the item marked as current. Item marked as current is underlined.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QMimeData *data, Qt::DropAction action, int row, int column, const QModelIndex &parent) override
memberdef.name: dropMimeData

briefdescription.para: Searches through the layer tree to find a legend node with a matching layer ID and rule key.
Returns OR-ed combination of model flags.

memberdef.argsstring: (int row, int column, const QModelIndex &parent=QModelIndex()) const override
memberdef.name: index

briefdescription.para: Returns layer tree node for given index.

detaileddescription.para: Returns root node for invalid index. Returns null pointer if index does not refer to a layer tree node (e.g. it is a legend node)

briefdescription.para: Convert a list of indexes to a list of layer tree nodes.

detaileddescription.para: Indices that do not represent layer tree nodes are skipped. If skipInternal is true, a node is included in the output list only if no parent node is in the list.

briefdescription.para: Returns filtered list of active legend nodes attached to a particular layer node (by default it returns also legend node embedded in parent layer node (if any) unless skipNodeEmbeddedInParent is true)
Returns original (unfiltered) list of legend nodes attached to a particular layer node.
Gets map of map layer style overrides (key: layer ID, value: style name) where a different style should be used instead of the current one.
Gets font for a particular type of layer tree node. nodeType should come from QgsLayerTreeNode::NodeType enumeration.
Returns the scale which restricts the legend nodes which are visible.

detaileddescription.para:
The scale value indicates the scale denominator, e.g. 1000.0 for a 1:1000 map. A scale <= 0 indicates that no scale filtering is being performed.
setLegendFilterByScale()
QGIS 2.6

briefdescription.para: Returns the current map settings used for the current legend filter (or null if none is enabled)
Gets hints about map view - to be used in legend nodes.

detaileddescription.para:
Arguments that are not null will receive values. If there are no valid map view data (from previous call to setLegendMapViewData()), returned values are zeros.
QGIS 2.6

briefdescription.para: Returns index for a given legend node.

detaileddescription.para:
If the legend node does not belong to the layer tree, the result is undefined. If the legend node is belongs to the tree but it is filtered out, invalid model index is returned.
QGIS 2.6

briefdescription.para: Returns legend node that may be embedded in parent (i.e.

detaileddescription.para:
its icon will be used for layer's icon).
QGIS 2.18

briefdescription.para: Returns index for a given node. If the node does not belong to the layer tree, the result is undefined.
Force a refresh of legend nodes of a layer node.

detaileddescription.para: Not necessary to call when layer's renderer is changed as the model listens to these events.

memberdef.argsstring: (int row, int count, const QModelIndex &parent=QModelIndex()) override
memberdef.name: removeRows

briefdescription.para: Returns pointer to the root node of the layer tree. Always a non-null pointer.
Sets at what number of legend nodes the layer node should be collapsed. Setting -1 disables the auto-collapse (default).
Sets index of the current item. May be used by view. Item marked as current is underlined.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QModelIndex &index, const QVariant &value, int role=Qt::EditRole) override
memberdef.name: setData

briefdescription.para: Enable or disable a model flag.
Sets OR-ed combination of model flags.
Sets map of map layer style overrides (key: layer ID, value: style name) where a different style should be used instead of the current one.
Sets font for a particular type of layer tree node. nodeType should come from QgsLayerTreeNode::NodeType enumeration.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QgsMapSettings *settings, bool useExtent=true, const QgsGeometry &polygon=QgsGeometry(), bool useExpressions=true)
memberdef.name: setLegendFilter

briefdescription.para: Filter display of legend nodes for given map settings.

parameterdescription.para: Map settings. Setting a null pointer or invalid settings will disable any filter. Ownership is not changed, a copy is made
Whether to use the extent of the map settings as a first spatial filter on legend nodes
If not empty, this polygon will be used instead of the map extent to filter legend nodes
Whether to use legend node filter expressions

briefdescription.para: Force only display of legend nodes which are valid for given map settings.

detaileddescription.para:
Setting null pointer or invalid map settings will disable the functionality. Ownership of map settings pointer does not change, a copy is made.
QGIS 2.6

briefdescription.para: Force only display of legend nodes which are valid for a given scale.

detaileddescription.para:
The scale value indicates the scale denominator, e.g. 1000.0 for a 1:1000 map. Setting scale <= 0 will disable the functionality.
legendFilterByScale()
QGIS 2.6

briefdescription.para: Give the layer tree model hints about the currently associated map view so that legend nodes that use map units can be scaled currectly.
Reset the model and use a new root group node.
Check whether a flag is enabled.
Returns legend node for given index.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns null for invalid index
QGIS 2.6

briefdescription.para: Updates model when node's name has changed.
Filter nodes from QgsMapLayerLegend according to the current filtering rules.
emit dataChanged() for layer tree node items
Updates layer data for scale dependent layers, should be called when map scale changes.

detaileddescription.para:
Emits dataChanged() for all scale dependent layers.
QGIS 2.16

briefdescription.para: Returns a temporary render context.
The QgsLayerTreeModel class is model implementation for Qt item views framework.

detaileddescription.para: The model can be used in any QTreeView, it is however recommended to use it with QgsLayerTreeView which brings additional functionality specific to layer tree handling.
The model listens to the changes in the layer tree and signals the changes as appropriate, so that any view that uses the model is updated accordingly.
Behavior of the model can be customized with flags. For example, whether to show legend or whether to allow changes to the layer tree.
